alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 3:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered thunderstorms with heavy rain extending from Downtown Savannah to near Hilton Head. Earlier showers and thunderstorms produced nearly an inch in some parts of Downtown Savannah. Social media reports on Twitter show some flooding of roadways is occurring, mainly along portions of Presidents Street into the far eastern portions of Downtown Savannah. With additional storms potentially moving over this area, a Flood Advisory has been issued. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hutchinson Island, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Wilmington Island, Hunter Army Airfield, Thunderbolt, Whitemarsh Island, Savannah Historic District, Isle Of Armstrong, Gordonston, Fernwood, Lepageville, Savannah State University, Fleetwood, Bona Bella, Edgemere, Fairfield and Ridgewood.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
